current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To codify in law the establishment and duties of the Office of Complex Administrative
			 Investigations in the National Guard Bureau, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: National Guard Investigations Transparency and Improvement Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Guard Investigations Transparency and Improvement Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Codification in law of establishment and duties of the Office of Complex Administrative
			 Investigations in the National Guard Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Office of the Chief of the National Guard Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (in this section referred to as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Office of Complex
			 Administrative Investigations

text.#text: There is in the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be under the direction and supervision of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Office

Chief of the National Guard
			 Bureau

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be to undertake complex administrative investigations of matters
			 relating to members of the National Guard when in State status, including
			 investigations of sexual assault involving a member of the National Guard
			 in such status, upon the request of any of the following:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Office

text.#text: The duties of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Chief of the National Guard Bureau

text.#text: The
An adjutant general of a State or territory or the District of Columbia.

The governor  of a State or territory, or the Commanding General of the National Guard of the
			 District of Columbia.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for purposes
			 of this section) involving factors giving rise to unusual complexity in
			 investigation, including the following:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Chief of the National Guard Bureau

text.#text:
For purposes of this subsection, a complex administrative investigation is any investigation (as
			 specified by the
Questions of jurisdiction between the United States and a State or territory.
Matters requiring specialized training among investigating officers.

Matters raising the need for an independent investigation in order to ensure fairness and
			 impartiality in investigation.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in accordance with criteria specified by the

Chief of
			 the National Guard Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for purposes of this section.

A summary description of the
